WizardTD

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • WizardTD.Tile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grass, Path, Shrub, Wizard

    public abstract class Tile
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      protected processing.core.PImage tileImg

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tile(int x, int y, processing.core.PApplet app, processing.core.PImage tileImg, boolean towerPlaceable, boolean isPath)
      Constructor called whenever Tile object is created.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void display()
      Displays the tile object at its x and y positions, multiplying x by 32 and y by 32 then adding 40 to adjust it to the correct position as each is 32 pixels long and wide.
      int getX()
      Returns the value of the x attribute.
      int getY()
      Returns the value of the y attribute.
      boolean path()
      Returns value of isPath attribute.
      void placed()
      Sets the value of towerPlaceable to false as tower has already been placed.
      boolean towerAble()
      Returns value of the towerPlaceable attribute.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(int x,
            int y,
            processing.core.PApplet app,
            processing.core.PImage tileImg,
            boolean towerPlaceable,
            boolean isPath)
        Constructor called whenever Tile object is created.
        Parameters:
        x - int of x position.
        y - int of y position.
        app - a reference of PApplet passed to allow this class to call relevant drawing functions.
        tileImg - PImage of the tile.
        towerPlaceable - boolean whether tower is allowed to be placed on the tile.
        isPath - boolean of whether this tile is a path.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the tile object at its x and y positions, multiplying x by 32 and y by 32 then adding 40 to adjust it to the correct position as each is 32 pixels long and wide.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the value of the x attribute.
        Returns:
        int of the x value

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the value of the y attribute.
        Returns:
        int of the y value

      • towerAble

        public boolean towerAble()
        Returns value of the towerPlaceable attribute.
        Returns:
        boolean if tower can be placed or not.

      • placed

        public void placed()
        Sets the value of towerPlaceable to false as tower has already been placed.

      • path

        public boolean path()
        Returns value of isPath attribute.
        Returns:
        boolean if this tile is a path or not.
